Description: Rim and wall fragment of a shallow pottery dish. Glaze fired light to mid orange. On rim, key maeander band; on floor, metope decoration consisting of vertical strokes and rosettes; slight part of central motif preserved. Exterior: dot band on edge of lip; three bands on wall. Coarse light orange clay with much lime inclusions.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 226, no. 126)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 114, pl. XXXV, no. 324.9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.672)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4711 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
